PAGE: 1
HEADING: AASEN

Aario, Leo Eino (1906-x), Finnish botanist; originally Leo Eino Engman. (<em>Aario</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 1; BJI 1: 1; BL 2: 86, 91 (Engman), 92.

18.786. <em>Pflanzentopographische und Paläogeographische Mooruntersuchungen</em> in N-Sata-
kunta ... Helsinki 1932. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1932, p. [1]-179, <em>pl. 1-16</em> (phot.), Beilagen i-viii (maps, diagr., uncol.). <em>Copy</em>: U. -
	Issued as <em>Fennia</em> (Soc. geogr. fenn.) 55, 1932.

Aaronsohn, Aaron (1876/1877-1919), American agriculturist, later resident in Haifa as
technical advisor of the United States Department of Agriculture. (<em>Aarons</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: AAR, further material in B, G, S.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 1 (d. 15 Mai 1919); BJI 2: 1 (refs. to 3 reviews
of his work); Hortus 3: 1187; IH 2: 25; KR p. 1; Tucker 1: 27.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Aaronsohn, A., Bull. Soc. bot. France 60: 474-476, <em>pl. 11.</em> 1913 ("un immigrant
	californien en Palestine").
Åkerman, E.A., Sv. Utsädesför. Tidskr. 29: 165-168. 1919 (on his activities in plant breeding).
Coulter, J.M., Bot. Gaz. 68: 388-389. 1919 (obit., portr.).
Oppenheimer, H.R., Reliquiae Aaronsonianae, Bull. Soc. bot. Genève 22: 126-409. 15 Mar
	1931 (introduction: biogr. and bibl. of A.); Florula transiordanica, Genève 1931 (Revision
	of plants collected and partially collected by Aaronsohn 1904-1908 in "Transjordan" and
	Wâdi el'Araba).
Oulaham, R.V., New York Times 19 Mai 1919 (notice of his death on a flight from London
	to Paris, "the discoverer of wild wheat".).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Numerous identifications in H.R. Oppenheimer (b. 1900). <em>Reliquiae
Aaronsohnianae</em> ... I. <em>Florula transiordanica</em>, Genève 1931, see TL-2/7094. <em>Copies</em>: FAS, US.

<sm>POSTAGE STAMPS</sm>: Israel 13 Isr.£ (1979) yv. 749.

18.787. <em>Über die in Palästina und Syrien wildwachsend aufgefundenen Getreidearten</em> ...
Separat-Abdruck aus den Verhandlungen der k.k. zoologisch-botanischen Gesellschaft in
Wien ... 1909. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1909 (submitted 22 Feb 1906), cover (identif.), [485]-509. <em>Copy</em>: B. - Reprinted and
	to be cited from Verh. k.k. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien 59: 485-509. 1909.

18.788. <em>Contribution à l'histoire des céréales</em>. Le Blé, l'Orge et le Seigle à l'état sauvage ...
Extrait du Bulletin de la Société botanique de France ... 1909. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: Jun (sero) 1909, cover-t.p., p. [1]-23. <em>Copy</em>: B. - Reprinted and to be cited from Bull.
	Soc. bot. France 56 (3-4): 196-203, 237-245, 251-258. Jun (sero) 1909.

18.789. <em>Agricultural and botanical explorations in Palestine</em> ... Washington 1910. Oct. (<em>Agr. bot. expl. Palestine</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 4 Aug 1910 (date on cover t.p.; ÖBZ Aug 1910; Nat. Nov. Oct. (1) 1910), cover-t.p., p.
	[1]-64, <em>pl. 1-9. Copies</em>: MO, NY, U. - Issued as Bull. U.S.D.A. Bureau Pl. Industry no. 180.

Aasen, Ivar Andreas (1813-1896), Norwegian botanist. (<em>Aasen</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1:1; BL2: 441, 621; Jackson p. 11 [err. Copenha-
gen?]; Rehder 1:73.

HEADING: ABBADO

plantenamn").

<em>Ref</em>.: Djupedal, R., Blyttia 17(2): 61-66. 1959 (notes on his Norske plantenavne).

Abbado, Michele (fl. 1900-1915), Italian phytopathologist, Dr. sci. nat., assistant at the R.
Scuola superiore d'Agricoltura, and professor of natural history at the Lyceum Beccacia,
Milano. (<em>Abbado</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: PAD.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 12(2): 645; Barnhart 1:2; IH 2: 25; Saccardo 2: 7.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Ciferri, R., Taxon 1(8): 126. 1952 (col. at PAD).
Dörfler, I., Botaniker-Adressbuch ed. 3. 183. 1909.

18.791. <em>Monografia dei generi Allescherina e Cryptovalsa</em> ... Genova (Tipografia di Angelo
Ciminago ...) 1902. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: Jul-Aug 1902 (p.[3]: Jul 1902), cover-t.p., p. [1]-44. <em>Copies</em>: B, BR. - Reprinted and
	to be cited from Malpighia 16: 291-330. 1902.

* Abbayes, Henri [Robert] Nicollon des (1898-1974), French lichenologist; studied at the
Richelieu College, Luçon (Vendée), baccalaureat 1915; studied natural sciences at the Faculté
catholique, Angers, on active service 1917-1920, wine-salesman 1924-1931, settled in Saint
Brieuc 1926, actively collecting in Western France, moved to Rennes, Lic. Sci. nat. Univ.
Rennes 1930, 1931 zoological assistant ib., from 1933 assistant in botany, Dr. Sci. 1934,
laureat Institut de France 1940, lecturer in botany at Rennes 1943, full professor 1952, in
charge of botany in the School of Medicine and Pharmacy 1938-1958, retired 1968; collected
in French-Guinea and Ivory Coast 1948, 1951, 1954; id. Réunion, Mauritius 1956. (<em>Abbayes</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: REN (worldwide, mainly Lich.), other material at FH, IFAN, K, M
(exsicc.), NTM, PC, US; for sets of exsiccatae see IH 2: 25. - Abbayes left his herbarium
and library to L. Massé, Rennes, deposited in REN.
<em>Exsiccatae</em>: (1) <em>Lichenes armoricani spectabilis exsiccati</em> fasc. 1-3 (nos. 1-60). 1929, 4
(61-80). 1930, 5 (81-100). 1932, 6 (101-120). 1936. - See IH 2: 25.
(2) <em>Lichenes gallici et nonnulli alii exsiccati</em> fasc. 1-2 (1-40). 1936, 3 (41-60). 1937. See IH
2: 25 and Rev. bryol. lichénol. 10: 117. 1937.
(3) <em>Lichenes madagascarienses et borbonici exsiccati</em> fasc. 1 (1-20). 1961, 2 (21-40). 1966.
See IH 2: 25.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: GR p. 264, pl. [29]; IH 2: 25; LS suppl. 1: 2; Roon p. 9;
TL-2/1: 1.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Rev. bryol. lichénol. 18(1-2): 85. 1949 (on trip to Africa).
Abbayes, H. des, [Information from A.C. de Roon, in TL-2/files at NY].
Chadefaud, M., Bull. Soc. bot. France 122 (7-8): 339-342. 1974 (obit., portr., on his work as
	a lichenologist, work on Cladina).
Dupont, P., Bull. Soc. Sci. Ouest France 72(4): 1-4. 1974.
Grumman, V., Cat. lich. german., Stuttgart 1963, p. 59 (abbreviation of name proposed: "des
	Abb.").
Hansen, A., Bot. bibliogr. Azores 1970, p. 1 (2 titles).
Hertel, H., Mitt. Bot. Staatssamml. München 16: 339. 1980 (exsicc.).
Hertel, H. and A. Schreiber, Mitt. Bot. Staatssamml. München 26: 138. 1988 (coll. at M).
Hunt Library, Biogr. Dict. bot. portrait coll. 1. 1972.

	Lichenol. Newsletter 11(2): 8. 1978 (on herb. and library, left to Massé at REN).

Sayre, G., C.E.B. Bonner and W.L. Culberson, Bryologist 67: 114. 1964 (abbr. proposed:
	"Abb.").

(3) Editor, <em>Flore et végétation du massif armoricain</em>, 1. <em>Flore vasculaire</em> 1971, on p.
xxiii-xxviii. 1972 (notes on botanists cited).

Sci. Bretagne ... 1931 [1932]. Oct.

	- Reprinted and to be cited from Bull. Soc. Sci. Bretagne 8 (3-4): 46-54. 1931 (Actual date

	Mattick, F., Bot. Jahrb. 67 (Lit.): 54-55. 29 Feb 1936 (review of thesis).

HEADING: ABBE

18.798. <em>De speciebus generis lichenum Cladoniae ex insulis Tristan da Cunha</em> ... [Oslo

Abbe, Ernst Cleveland (1905-x), American botanist, B.S. Cornell Univ. 1928, M.S. ib. 1930,
M.A. Harvard 1931; Dr. phil. Cornell (1933?) 1934; botanical assistant at Cornell 1927-1930,
at Harvard Univ. 1931-1933, Natl. Res. council fellow in biology 1934-1935, from 1935 at
Bot. Dept., University of Minnesota, 1959-1962 National Science Foundation fellow stu-
dying Fagaceae and Myricaceae in S.E. Asia. Collected in northern Labrador 1931, in N.
Alberta and N.E. Brit. Columbia 1932, eastern Keewatin and Western Quebec 1939, [in New
Guinea 1962, Sarawak 1964]. (<em>Abbe</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Until 1935 first set of specimens at GH, later collections at MIN. -
Duplicates A, CAN, CU, DAO, E, GH, K, MIN, MT, NO, NY, PH (Quebec).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 2 (b. 21 Aug 1905, data directly from author);
BL1: 137; IH 2: 25, 110, 737; SK 8: ix.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Abbe, E.C., An informal history of the Department of Botany, University of
	Minnesota 1887-1950, Minnesota 1972, 13 p. [not published].
Boivin, B., in litt. to FAS 12 Sep 1979, info on Canadian collections.
Ewan, J. et al., Short hist. bot. U.S. 119. 1969.

18.799. <em>Botanical results of the Grenfell-Forbes northern Labrador expedition</em>, 1931 ...
Reprinted from Rhodora ... 1936. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: Apr 1936 (in journal), p. [reprint-t.p.], [i], 102-164, <em>pl. 408-411. Copies</em>: MO, U, US.
	- Contr. Gray Herb. Harvard Univ. 111, 1936, reprinted and to be cited from Rhodora 38:
	102-164. <em>pl. 408-411.</em> 1936.

* Abbot, Charles (1761-1817), British clergyman, botanist and lepidopterist, MA Oxford
1788, DD. ib. 1802, Vicar of Oakley Raynes 1798 and Goldington, Beds. 1803. (<em>C. Abbot</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LTN (earlier at Turvey Abbey, Beds.), other material at LINN.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 2; BB p. 1; BL 2: 228, 621; BM 1: 1; Dawson p.
3-5 (letter to Banks); Desmond p. 1 (b. Blandford, Dorset 24 Mar 1761, d. Bedford 8 Sep
1817; further references); DNB 1: 3; GR p. 387; Henrey 3: no. 378; Jackson p. 248; Kew 1:
2; LS 648; PR no. 1, PR ed. 1: p.1; Rehder 1: 396; SO 763a, 1233; TL-2/1: 1; Tucker 1: 27.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Bridson, G.D.R. et al., Nat. hist. mss. resources Brit. Isles 379. 1980 (references to
	manuscripts).
Dawson, W.R., Cat. mss. Linn. Soc. London, 1. Smith papers 7. 1934 (letters to J.E. Smith at LINN).
Dony, J.G., Charles Abbot's Flora selecta, Bedford Naturalist 23: 27-29. 1969 (herb. in 5
	vols. rd. 1968 in LTN), see also his Fl. Hertfordshire 12. 1967.
Fournier, E., <em>in</em> H.E. Baillon, Dict. bot. 1: 3. 1876.
Hawksworth, D.L. and M.R.D. Seaward, Lichenology Brit. Isl. 1568-1975. 13, 46, 197. 1933
	(lichens at LINN).
Kent, D.H., Brit. herbaria 39. 1957 (4 vols. at LTN not localised by Kent; LINN).
Pryor, R.A., J. Bot. 19: 40-46, 67-75. 1881 (notes on herbarium then still at Turvey Abbey).
Sayre, G., Bryologist 80(3): 503. 1977 (coll. Bryoph.).
Smith, P., Mem. Corr. J.E. Smith 2: 84. 1832.

HEADING: ABEL

	be cited from Trillia 9: 62-69. 1930.

Abbott, Francis, Jr. (1834-1903), English born botanist and gardener, from ca. 1851
connected with the Botanical Gardens at Hobart, Tasmania (Australia), from 1859-1903
superintendent of the Gardens succeeding F.W. Newman. (<em>F. Abbott</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 4 (b. 18 Jun 1834, d. 22 Nov 1903); BB p. 1;
CSP 9: 3; Desmond p. 1; HU portr. coll. 1; Jackson p. 453 (attributes <em>Cat. of Plants</em> 1865 to
him); Rehder 1: 69.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Abbott, Francis Jr. 1834-1903, unidentified curr. vitae and list of publications
	in TL-2/files.
Gager, C.S., Brooklyn Bot. Gard. Record 27(3): 339. 1938 (superint. 1859-1903).
Maiden, J.H., Records of Tasmanian Botanists (Roy. Soc. Tasmania 1909), p. 2-3; Pap. Proc.
	R. Soc. Tasmania 1909: 10-11 (brief obit. b. 18 Jun 1834, Derby, England, d. 22 Nov 1903,
	Hobart).
Wilson, E.H., J. Arnold Arb. 3: 52-53. 1921.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Jackson attributes the anonymous <em>Catalogue of plants</em> ... Royal Society's Gardens,
Queen's Park, Hobart Town 1865, Oct. to him. This seems likely because Abbott was then
superintendent.

* Abel, Clarke (1789-1826), British surgeon and botanist, chief medical officer to Lord
Amherst's mission in China 1816-1817, shipwrecked on his return in H.M.S. Alceste; with
Lord Amherst in India 1823-1826. (<em>C. Abel</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: see treatment TL-2/1: 1-2.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 1 (b. 1780?); Barnhart 1: 6 (b. 5 Sep 1789, d. 14
Nov 1826); BB p. 1; BM 1: 2; Bradley 5(ind.): 2; Bret. p. 225-227; CSP 1: 4; Dawson p. 5;
Desmond p. 1 (b. 1780, d. 14 Nov 1826 Cawnpore, India); DNB 1: 32-33 (by B.D. Jackson,
b. 1780); Frank 3 (Anh.): 3; Hortus 3: 1187; IH 2: 25; Kew 1:3; Lasègue p. 435, 503 (coll.);
MW p. 1; PR 2; TL-2/1: 1-2; Tucker 1: 27; Zander ed. 10, p. 627; ed. 11, p. 712.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Allan, M., The Hookers of Kew 72. 1967.
Anon., Monthly Rev. ser. 2. 88: 113-124. Feb 1819, 364-378. Apr 1819; Quarterly Rev.,
	London 21(41): 67-91. Jan 1819 (review of Narrative, with extracts).
Carter, H.B., Sir Joseph Banks 504, 505. s.d.
Coats, A.N., Quest for plants, the Plant Hunters 94-95. 1969 (portr.).
Cox, E.H.M., Plant hunting in China 50-51. 1945.
Crawford, D.G., Hist. Indian Med. Service 1600-1913, 2: 146. 1914 (fide Desmond).
Dawson, W.R., The Banks letters 5. 1958.
Fisher, J., The origin of garden plants 225. 1982.
Jessen, K.F.W., Bot. Gegenw. Vorz. 469. 1864.
Lyte, C., Sir Joseph Banks 174, 175. 1980.
Mabberley, D.J., Jupiter botanicus 212-214, 226, 406. 1985.
Murray, G., Hist. coll. nat. hist. depts. Brit. Mus. 1: 129. 1904 (part of the Chinese collections;
	major part lost in shipwreck Alceste).

HEADING: ABEL

Abel, Lothar (fl. 1882), Austrian dendrologist. (<em>L. Abel</em>).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 1: 2; Rehder 5(index): 2; Tucker 1: 27.

18.801. <em>Die Baumpflanzungen</em> in der Stadt und auf dem Lande; aestetische und volks-
wirthschaftliche Begründung der Dendrologie ... Wien (G.P. Faesy) 1882. Oct. (<em>Baumpflan-
zungen</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jan 1882 (Bot. Zeit. 24 Feb 1882; Nat. Nov. Jun (2) 1882), p. [i]-viii, [1]-138. <em>Copy</em>:
	BM (n.v.).
<em>Note</em>: published, with F. Antoine and J. Böhm, Ergebniss der Expertise von 1880 über die
	städtische Baumpflanzungen in Wien. Wien 1880 (Bot. Zeit. 28 Jan 1881).

Abel, Othenio (1875-1946), Austrian botanist, professor of palaeontology at the University
of Vienna, visited the United States and Cuba in 1925, sometime editor of Palaeobiologica.
(<em>O. Abel</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 3: 843 (b. 20 Jun 1875, Wien); Barnhart 1: 6; DSB 1:
17-18 (by M. Baumgärtel); Ewan ed. 2: 1.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Janchen, E., Cat. Fl. Austr. 1: 11, 21. 1956.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Published <em>Bau und Geschichte der Erde</em>, Wien (F. Tompsky), Leipzig (G. Freytag)
1909. Oct., viii, 220 p., publ. Jan-Feb 1909. - Review A. Kneucker, Allg. bot. Zeit. 15: 42.
1909.

18.802. <em>Einige Monstrositäten bei Orchideenblüthen</em>. (Ophrys aranifera Huds. und Orchis
coriophora L.) ... [Aus Verh. k.k. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien besonders abgedruckt ... 1897]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: Jul-Dec 1897 (read 29 Jun 1897), cover, p. [1]-6. <em>Copy</em>: G. - Reprinted and to be cited
	from Verh. k.k. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien 47: 415-420. 1897.

18.803. <em>Ueber einige Ophrydeen</em> ... (Aus den Verhandlungen der k.k. zoologisch-botanischen
Gesellschaft in Wien ...) 1898. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1898 (read 23 Apr 1898), p. [1]-7. <em>Copy</em>: WU. - Reprinted and to be cited from Verh.
	k.k. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien 48: 306-311. 1898.

Abele, Karlis (1896-?), Latvian botanist at the botanical institute of the University of Riga.
(<em>Abele</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 6 (b. 1896).

18.804. <em>Entwicklungsgeschichtliche Untersuchungen über die Piperaceen</em> - Peperomia
Verschaffeltii Lem. und P. metallica L. Linden et Rodigas ... Sonderabzug aus Latvias
Universitates Raksti Acta Universitatis Latviensis ... 1923. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1923, p. [371]-398. <em>Copy</em>: B. - Reprinted and to be cited from Acta Univ. Latv. 8:
	371-398. 1923.
<em>Ref</em>.: Krause, K., Bot. Jahrb. 59 (Lit.): 96. 1924 (rev.)

* Abeleven, Theodorus Hendrik Arnoldus Jacobus (1822-1904), Dutch botanist, phar-
macist and highschool teacher at a highschool in Nijmegen, Netherlands 1865-1899, also
botany teacher at the Nijmegen Gymnasium; secretary of the Nederlandsche Botanische
Vereeniging 1867-1897. (<em>Abeleven</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: L, NBV.

Abendroth, Wilhelm Friedrich (1802-1863), German clinical physician, born at Pirna nr.
Dresden (Sachsen), educated at a secondary school at Meissen; studied medicine at the
University of Leipzig 1820-1825 with a stay in Vienna 1824-1825 specializing in clinical
medicine, Dr. phil. Leipzig 1825. (<em>Abendroth</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Abraham Augustin Abendroth (1727-1786) was one of contributors to Giseke, P.D.
et al., <em>Icones plantarum</em> adjectis nominibus Linnaeanis, fasc. 1-4, 100 pl. Fol., Hamburg 1777.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 6; BM 1: 3; PR 4, ed. 1: 1 ("72" p.); Rehder
5(index): 2; Tucker 1: 27.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Abendroth, W.F., [brief autobiogr. sketch in <em>De Coffea</em>] p. 9-12. (son of a pharmacist,
	studied at Meissen, Leipzig and Vienna, specialized as a clinical physician).
	Baillon, H.E., Dict. bot. 1: 3. 1876.

18.807. <em>The garden mushroom</em>: its nature and cultivation. A treatise, exhibiting full and plain

<em>Publ</em>.: 1779, p. [1]-54. <em>Copy</em>: L.

18.808. <em>The universal gardener</em> and botanist; or, a general dictionary of gardening and botany.
Exhibiting in botanical arrangement, according to the Linnaean system, every tree, shrub,
and herbaceous plant, that merit culture, either for use, ornament, or curiosity, in every
department of gardening. Comprising accurate directions, according to real practice, for the
management of the kitchen-garden ... forcing in general ... Describing the proper situations,
exposures, soils, manures; and every material and utensil requisite in the different garden
departments; together with practical directions for performing the various mechanical ope-
rations of gardening in general ... London (printed for G. Robinson, ... and T. Cadell, ...) 1778.
Qu. (<em>Univ. Gardener</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: Thomas Mawe.
<em>Publ</em>.: 1778, p. [i-vii], [sign. B-6Z], index p. [1-14]. <em>Copy</em>: G.
<em>Ed. 2</em>: 1797, unpaged, <em>11 plates. Copy</em>: NY. - The second edition. Carefully revised,
	corrected, ... London (printed for G.G. and J. Robinson, ... and T. Cadell ...) 1797. Qu.

18.809. <em>A general system of trees and shrubs</em>. For all useful and ornamental plantations in
gardens, pleasure-grounds, shrubberies, parks, paddocks, woods, groves, walks, avenues,
clumps, thickets, hedges, hedgerows, arbours, orchards, fruit-tree plantations, and all other
plantation districts, eligible for the improvement and embellishment of gardens, estates, etc.
Forming a compleat general system of trees and shrubs, agreeable to the Linnaean system;

HEADING: ABERLE

being arranged in their respective genera or families, under the generical or botanic family

Åberg, [Johan] Gerhard [Göran] (1868-1940), Swedish bryologist studied at the cathedral
school at Lund 1887, med. lic. Lund 1900; provincial physician Sunne, Bergs distr. Jämtland
1914, Linnémedal Sv. Vet. Akad. 1934. (<em>Åberg</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: UPS (bryo., 14.000 <em>Sphagnum</em>); further material (bryoph.) in H, S,
UPS.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: For <em>Gunnar Åberg</em> (b. 1909), Finnish phanerogamist see Collander, R. et al., Bibl. bot.
fenn. 1901-1950: 590-591. 1973 (Acta Soc. Fauna Fl. Fenn. 81); <em>A. Ewart Åberg</em> (b. 4 Dec
1909), a taxonomist active at the Institute of Plant Husbandry working on Cereal taxonomy
and phylogeny.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 7; IH 2: 26; KR. p. 784 (b. 10 Nov 1868,

* Abrams, LeRoy (1874-1956), American (Sheffield, Iowa) botanist, at the University of
South California 1895, at Stanford University 1896, A.B. Stanford Jun 1899; acting professor
of botany at the University of Idaho 1899-1900, graduate student and assistant with W.R.
Russel at Stanford 1900-1902, MA. 1902, instructor in botany ib. 1902-1904; graduate fellow
in botany Columbia University working at the New York Botanical Garden 1904-1905 with
N.L. Britton, J.K. Small and P.A. Rydberg; assistant curator at the National Museum,
Washington, D.C. 1905-1906; assistant professor of botany at Stanford 1906-1912, associate
professor 1912, full professor 1920, head of the Department of Botany ib. 1933-1934, director
of the Natural History Museum ib. 1934-1940, emeritus professor of biology ib. 1940-1956,
continuing his work on the Illustrated flora of the Pacific States. (<em>Abrams</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: DS (at CAS); duplicates A, BM, CGE, DS, E, F, GH, K, MIN, MO,
MT, NMC, NY, P, PH, POM, RM, US, WTU; (Field notes at CAS (fide Stieber 1982).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 8 (further refs.); BFM 1580; BL 1: 162, 166; BM
6: 2; Bossert p. 2; Ewan ed. 1: 147, 199, ed. 2: 1; Hirsch p. 1187 (abbr. "Abrams"); IF suppl.
4: 330; IH 2: 26; Kew 1: 4; Langman p. 66; Lenley p. 1; NAF 28 B(2): 317 (by H.W. Rickett);
TL-1: 1; TL-2/1: 2-3 (nos. 5-6), see also 12.186; Tucker 1: 28.

PAGE: 11
HEADING: ABRAMS

* Abromeit, Johannes (1857-1946), German botanist at Königsberg i. Pr., born in Paschleit-
schen nr. Ragnit, East Prussia, studied at the Real-Gymnasium in Gumbinnen 1871-1876 and
at a similar institution in Königsberg i. Pr. 1877-1879; studied natural sciences at the
Albertus-Universität ib. 1879-1884 (natural sciences, philosophy, German literature); Dr.
phil. ib. 1884 with Robert Caspary; state-examination for teacher of secondary schools 1886,
assistant in botany at the Königsberg botanical institute from 1887, "Habilitation" 19 Mar
1900, private lecturer at the University 1900, extraordinary professor of botany (titular) 1911,
pensioned off 1930; prime mover of the Preussische Botanische Verein, fled to Jena 1944.
(<em>Abrom</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B. - Some further material at A, M (herb. Freiberg), PH. - The
original collections at Königsberg were destroyed by war action in 1945.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 2(1): 454; Barnhart 1: 8; BFM 151, 155; BL 2: 155; BM
6: 2; Bossert p. 2; CSP 9: 8, 13: 17-18; IH 2: 26; Kew 1: 5; LS 655-656, 30431, 40035; Rehder
1: 309, 5(index): 2; TL-2, 1: 3-4, see also 10.238, 15.919, 18.364; Urban-Berl. p. 323; Zander
ed. 10, p. 627, ed. 11, p. 712.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Abromeit, J., Geschichte des Preussischen Botanischen Vereins, Festschrift 50.J.
	Bestehen des Preussischen [Bot.] Vereins Königsberg vii-xxviii. Königsberg 1912.
Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 82(14): 32. 1900 (habil. Univ. Königsberg i. Pr.), 116(13): 352. 1911
	(app. professor of botany); Bot. Zeit. 58(9): 144. 1900 (habil. Königsberg, in botany);
	Hedwigia Beibl. 39(3): 112. 1900 (habil. Königsberg), 51(1): (88). 1911 (app. professor);
	Allg. bot. Z. 17: 64. 1911 (app. professor botany); Bot. Monatschr. 22(7): 112. 1911 (app.
	professor); Nat. Nov. 33: 190. 1911 (professor's title); ÖBZ 61: 119. 1911 (app. prof. bot.
	Königsberg), 86(2): 160. 1937 (80-th birthday 17 Feb 1937); Stader Tageblatt [Stade,
	Hannover] 26 Nov 1927 (brief evaluation).
Gross, H., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 58a (Nachrufe) (3): 206-210. 1956 (obit., bibl., b. 17 Feb 1857,
	d. 19 Jan 1946; n.b. bibl. not complete).
Pax, F., Bibl. Schles. Bot. 1929. no. 2316.

Acerbi, Giuseppe (1773-1846), Italian traveller, naturalist and botanist at Castelgoffredo,
visited Lapland 1798-1799, librarian and director of the Orto botanico di Brera, Milano
1817-1826; Austrian consul-general in Egypt 1826-1836, collecting in Sudan 1826-1835;
founded the Bibliotheca italiana. (<em>Acerbi</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Egyptian collections in BASSA and G-DC (489).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 9 (b. 3 Mai 1773, d. 25 Aug 1846); BM 1: 8; IH

4; Saccardo 1: 11, 178, 2: 7; TR p. 9 (no. 2); Tucker 1: 28.

* Acharius, Erik (1757-1819), Swedish lichenologist, born at Gävle, studied in Uppsala
1773-1776, Dr. phil. with Linnaeus 1776; Dr. med. Lund 1782, ultimately provincial medical
officer and, from 1795, chief physician at the Vadstena hospital; member Swedish Academy
of Sciences 1796; honorary professor's title 1803, Vasa order 1809. (<em>Achar</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Lichens and some algae at H (H-ACH), phan. and other crypt. at LD,
some types in BM (set of duplicates originally given to LINN), - some further material at
PH (through Muhlenberg) and B (through herb. Laurer, C (50 Lich.), K, M and UPS. - Note:
I. Kukkonen (in lit. 9 Jun 1978) informed us that the Helsinki Acharius collections were
bought by H from Billberg in 1834.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 94, 96, 312, 313; Barnhart 1: 9 (b. 10 Oct 1757,
d. 14 Aug 1819); BM 1: 8; Bossert p. 2; CSP 1: 9-10; Dawson p. 7; Dryander 3: 160, 336,
343; DSB 1: 45-46 (G. Eriksson); DTS 1: 1; Frank 3(Anh.): 3; GR p. 469, <em>pl</em>. [<em>2</em>]; IF p. 675;
IH 1 (ed. 6): 335, 2: 26; Kew 1: 5; KR p. 2-4 (main bibl.); Lasègue p. 27, 320, 324, 344, 359,
545; LS 657-678; Moebius p. 108, 110, 112; MW p. 1; NI 1; PR 8-11, ed. 1: 24-27; Rehder
5(index): 4; RS p. 71; TL-1: 1; TL-2/1: 4-5; other refs. 7247, 9153, see C.H. Persoon, A.J.
Retzius, J. Smith, K.P.J. Sprengel; Tucker 1: 28.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Almborn, O., Bot. Not. 133: 453, 454. 1980.
Anon., Flora 2(1): 252. 1819 ("... die Klage so vieler Botaniker über die vielen von Acharius
	auf unwesentliche Merkmale gegründeten Gattungen"), 2(2): 550. 1819 (d. 14 Aug 1819,
	Apoplexy, leaves a herbarium of 14.000 species (sic) will be sold); Biogr. lexicon
	namnkunn svenska män 1: 3-8. 1835; Bot. Zeit. 10: 742. 1852; Int. lichenol. Newsletter
	11(2): [s.n.]. 1878 (drawing of Acharius; comm. 175-th anniv. Methodus); Rev. bryol.
	lichénol. 34(1-2): 377. 1966 (collection of A. at LINN sold to BM).

<sm>CORRESPONDENCE</sm>: Uppsala; other letters at KVA, Stockholm.

Ackermann, Jacob Fidelis (1765-1815), German physician, Dr. phil. Mainz 1787, travelled
in Germany and Italy 1787-1789, habil. Mainz 1789 as Privatdozent (private lecturer) in
forensic medicine, subsequently full professor; president and professor at the Medical School,
Mainz 1798, id. anatomy and surgery at Jena 1804, id. Heidelberg 1805-1815; taught botany
at Heidelberg in 1812 as part of his medical curriculum. (<em>Ackermann</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 1: 36 (A. Hirsch; b. 23 Apr 1765, d. 28 Oct 1815);
Barnhart 1: 10; BM 1: 8; PR 12, ed. 1: no. 29.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Flora 4(1): 72. 1821 (taught botany at Heidelberg 1812).
Baillon, H.E., Dict. bot. 1: 32. 1876.
Schmid, Magn., Neue Deutsche Biographie 1: 37-38. 1953.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: Edited J.C. Döltz, <em>Neue Versuche über einige Pflanzengifte</em>. 1792.

wächs</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1812, p. [i], [1]-54. <em>Copies</em>: G, NY.

HEADING: ACOSTA SOLIS

Acloque, Alexandre Noel Charles (1871-1908), French botanist and ornithologist. (<em>Aclo-
que</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 10; BL 2: 97, 190, 204; BM 1: 9, 6: 3; GR p. 265;
Kew 1: 6; LS 681-684, 30434; TL-2/1: 6-7, see also 14.987; Tucker 1: 28.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Dörfler, I., Botaniker-Addressbuch ed. 1, 49. 1896, ed. 3, 90. 1909.
Ronsil, Bibl. Ornith. France no. 12. 1948.
Sayre, G. et al., Bryologist 67: 114. 1964 (suggested abbreviation "Acl.").

<sm>NOTE</sm> (1) on TL-2/14, <em>Les Champignons</em> originally published Nov 1891, was re-issued "Paris
1902" fide Bot. Zeit. 26 Apr 1902.
<sm>NOTE</sm> (2) on TL-2/15, Acloque, <em>Les lichens</em> 1893, actually published before 9 Dec 1892 fide
Bull. Soc. bot. France 39: 785. 1892, in report on session of 9 Dec 1892: a copy of the book
had been received before or on 9 Dec 1892. The ÖBZ mentions the book as early as Oct 1892
in its lists of new literature. The preface is dated 2 Oct 1892.
<sm>NOTE</sm> (3) on TL-2/16, Acloque, <em>Flore de France</em> 1894; copy submitted to Soc. bot. France
before or on 27 Apr 1894, hence clearly published Apr 1894. The ÖBZ (44: 226-227. 1
Jun 1894) lists the book as having been received in Apr 1894. Review by O. Drude in
Bot. Zeit. 52(20): 315-316. 1894. The 1894 book was also re-issued with a new t.p. <em>Flore
des environs de Paris</em>, our TL-2/18. q.v.; idem as <em>Flore de la region méditerranéenne de
la France</em>, our TL-2/22, q.v. This was done with all regional floras of 1904. The ÖBZ
(54: 151. 1904) - comments: "Verf. und Verleger treiben seit Monaten ein erheiterndes
Spiel mit der botanischen Welt. Fast jeden Monat erscheint ein dickbändiges Werk über
einen anderen Teil von Frankreich ... Diese Bücher sind <em>durchwegs vollständig gleich</em>
bis auf das Titelblatt und ein recht dürftiges, das betreffende Gebiet behandelndes
Verzeichnis, dass zwischen 48 und 49 eingeschoben wurde". - Reproduction of letter by
L.E. Bureau to the publishers, also printed in the book itself, in Bull. Soc. bot. France 41
(Rev. bibl.): 233-234. 1894 with notes by Malinvaux. The review by Malinvaux in Bull.
Soc. bot. France 50 (Rev. bibl.): 503-504. 1903 deals with the reissue of "1904" (sic)
TL-2/19, with the somewhat misleading new t.p. <em>Flore du Nord de la France</em> (see also
J. Bot. 41: 384. Nov 1903).

Acosta Solis, Misael (1910-x), Ecuadorian botanist, director of the Instituto botanico, Quito
ca. 1938, professor of botany and pharmacognosy ib. (<em>Acosta Solis</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Q, duplicates F (8000), GH, MICH, US (370).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 10; IH 2: 26.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Acosta Solis, M., Bio-bibliografia, Quito, Ecuador, s.d. [Mai 1941], 27 p., Curricu-
	lum vitae del Dr. Misael Acosta Solis, Publicacion Miscelanea del I.E.C.N., Quito,
	Ecuador, Octubre 1967 (biogr. sketch, bibl., b. 10 Dec 1910); Inst. Ecuat. Cienc. nat. Centr.
	65: 79-111, 127-129. 1968 (collecting trips and bot. collections by author in Q.; p. 75:
	author born 16 Dec 1910; portr., bibl.).
Frodin, D.G., Guide standard floras world 576. 1984.
Miller, R.B., Taxon 34: 178. 1985 (letters at Forest Products Lab., Madison, Wisc.).
Stieber, M.T. et al., Huntia 4(1): 12. 1981 (b. 1910, complimentary card in Hunt Institute
	archives).

18.827. <em>Galapagos</em> observado fitologicamente ... Quito-Ecuador (Imprenta de la Universidad
Central) 1937. Oct. (<em>Galapagos</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1937 (p. 78: Oct 1937), cover-t.p., [1]-78. <em>Copy</em>: U.

Adametz, R. Leopold (1861-?), Moravian (Brünn, Brno) bacteriologist and veterinarian,
educated in Zeidler's, Lehr- und Erziehungsanstalt in Dresden (Saxony) 1870-1876; at the
Wiedner Communal-Oberrealschule in Wien (Vienna) 1876-1881, studied at the Hochschule
für Bodenkultur, Wien Jul 1881-Jul 1884, at the University of Leipzig 1884-1886, Ph. D.
Leipzig 1886; later extraordinary professor of animal husbandry in Krakau, ordinary profes-
sor ib. 1891. (<em>Adametz</em>).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 232, 320; Barnhart 1: 12; BM 1: 9; LS 686-689,
suppl. 1, no. 70.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 48: 239. 1891 (app. Krakau).

18.830. <em>Untersuchungen über die niederen Pilze der Ackerkrume</em> ... Inaugural-Dissertation
zur Erlangung der Doctorwürde der philosophischen Facultät der Universität Leipzig ...
Leipzig (Druck von Bär &amp; Hermann) 1886. Oct. (<em>Unters. Pilze Ackerkrume</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1886 (Bot. Zeit. 31 Dec 1886, Nat. Nov. Dec (2) 1886), p. [1, t.p. 3], 4-78, [79-80],
	<em>pl. 1-2</em> (p.p. col. liths.). <em>Copy</em>: U. - Has a "vita" of the author on p. [80], b. 12 Nov 1861,
	Brünn [Brno] in Moravia.

Adami, Ernst Daniel (1716-1795), German (born in Zduny (Posen/Poznan)) botanist and
highschool teacher at Landeshutt (Lower Silesia), died in Pommerwitz (Silesia). (<em>Adami</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 12 (b. 19 Nov 1716, Zduny; d. 29 jan 1795,
Pommerwitz, Schlesien); Dryander 3: 379; PR 16.

18.831. <em>Freye Gedanken</em> über das seltne und Betrachtungswürdige an einem zu Landeshutt
1755 gefällten <em>Buchen-Baum</em> mit welchen die physicalische Mögligkeit desselben aus sichren
Gründen der Natur Wissenschaft darstellet ... Breslau (bey Carl Gottfr. Meyer) 1756. Oct. (<em>Freye Ged. Buchen-Baum</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1756 (p. [6]: preface signed 1 Jan 1756), frontispiece, p. [1]-77. <em>Copy</em>: B-S.

* Adamovic, Lujo (1864-1935), Dalmatian botanist, born at Dubrovnik (Ragusa); distribu-
ted Dalmatian plant material in 1889; in Serbia 1889, highschool teacher at Vranja 1890-1900,
Dr. phil. Berlin 1898 with Engler. Director of the Botanical Garden and professor of botany
in Belgrade 1901-1905, "Habilitation" Univ. Vienna 1906; "Privatdozent" 1906-1914;
employed by the Austrian govt. to study the floristics of the Balcan peninsula from 1906
onward. In retirement living in Dubrovnik, Dalmatia. (<em>Adamovic</em>).

PAGE: 19
HEADING: ADAMOVIC

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: <em>Plantae Balcanicae Exs</em>. coll. 1896-1910: B, BP, IBF, K, LAU, LE,
M, W, WU. - Further material in many herbaria, major sets in B (only partly extant), W and
WU; for further information see IH2: 27.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 5(1): 588-589; Barnhart 1: 12 (b. 31 Jul 1864); BFM
1672-1673; BJI 2: 329; BL 2: 329, 330; Hortus 3: 1187; IH 2: 27; LS 30.487; PFC 2(2): xviii;
Rehder 1: 450, 451, 5(index): 5; TL-2/1: 8; Tucker 1: 29; Urban-Berl. p. 324; Zander ed. 10,
p. 627, ed. 11, p. 712.

	trips 1890-1908, list of publ. 1891-1909 (45 items)); Die Pflanzenwelt der Adrialänder
	1929, p. 163-164 (list of 27 publications by author on the Adria area).

	(app. prof. Belgrade), 102(48): 592. 1906 (Habil. Univ. Wien); Bot. Jahrb. 31 (Beibl. 69):
	39. 1902. (app. prof. Belgrade); Hedwigia (Beibl.) 40(5): 174. 1901 (app. prof. Belgrade),
	45(1): 39. 1906 (travelled several months in Balcan peninsula), 76(2): 140. 1936; ÖBZ 51:
	223. 1901 (app. prof. Belgrade), 84(4): 320. 1935 (d. 27 Jul 1935), 85(1): 80. 1936 (died
	actually 19 Jul 1935 in Dubrovnik ([Ital.: Ragusa], Dalmatia), (the date 19 Jul 1935 is
	probably correct); Nat. Nov. 27: 333. 1905 (resigned position as director of Bot. gard.
	Belgrado).

	now at Univ. Libr. Uppsala).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jan 1909 (preface 15 Dec 1908; Nat. Nov. Jan 1909, ÖBZ rd. Oct-Nov 1909, Allg.

	not coloured). <em>Copy</em>: FAS.
<em>Note</em>: The term "Mösische Länder" in the title refers to the Balkan Peninsula with the
	exception of S. and C. Greece: in the present configuration the center part of Yugoslavia,
	Bulgaria, European Turkey, northern Greece and Albania. The travelling of Adamovic was
	sponsored by the Kais. Akademie der Wissenschaften, Wien and the Naturhistorische
	Orientverein, Wien; the publication took place through A. Engler and the Kön. Preuss.

Adams, George Sr. (1720-1786), British optician and mathematical instrument maker. (<em>G.
Adams, Sr.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 13 (d. 5 Mar 1786); BB p. 2; BM 1: 10; Desmond
p. 3 (d. 5 Mar 1786); DNB 1: 97; Jackson p. 219; PR 17, ed. 1: 39; Rehder 1: 36, 5(index): 5.

<sm>MANUSCRIPTS</sm>: Royal Society, London.

18.859. <em>Micrographia illustrata</em>, or the knowledge of the microscope explained: together with
an account of a new invented universal, single or double, microscope, either of which is
capable of being applied to an improved solar apparatus. This treatise contains a description
of the nature, uses, and magnifying powers of microscopes in general; ... The whole being,
as it were, a natural history of a multitude of aerial, terrestrial, and aquatic animals, seeds,
plants, etc. ... London (Printed for, and sold by the author) 1746. Qu. (<em>Microgr. ill.</em>).

<em>Ed. 1</em>: 1746, <em>pl. 1</em> (frontisp.), [1]-16, [1]-263, <em>pl. 2-65. Copy</em>: NY.
<em>Ed. 2</em>: 1747, <em>pl. 1</em> (frontisp.), [1]-16, [1]-263, <em>pl. 2-65.</em> Copy: NY.
<em>Ed. 3</em>: unknown.
<em>Ed. 4</em>: 1771, [p. i*-xvi*], [i]-lix, [1]-325, [1]-14, <em>pl. 1-57, 57</em> (<em>bis</em>), <em>58-71</em>, (<em>pl. 1</em> bound as
	frontisp.). <em>Copy</em>: NY.

Adams, George Jr. (1750-1795), London optician and microscopist. (<em>G. Adams, Jr.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

* Adams, [Adam], [Johann] Michael Friedrich (1780-1829/1832), Russian botanist, zoologist,
and collector, studied medicine in St. Petersburg 1795-1796, travelled with Count Mussin-Pushkin
in Transcaucasia 1800-1805; later with Golowkin to China, travelled along the Lena 1806-1807,
settled later in Moscow as adj. professor of botany at the medical academy. (<em>M.F. Adams</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LE; further material in B (260, used by Chamisso, p.p. in B-Willd.),
H (herb. Steven, 400).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 1: 45 (by Jesse); AG 3: 459 (Adam), 6(1): 887 (Adams);
Barnhart 1: 14 (as Adams); BM 1: 9 (Adam); Hortus 3: 1187; Lasègue p. 330, 415, 416, 421;
PR 15 ("Adam"); Rehder 5(index): 5; TL-2/1: 8; TR 3-7; Tucker 1: 29; Urban-Berl. p. 324,
414; Zander ed. 10, p. 627, ed. 11, p. 712.

Adams, John (1872-1950), Irish botanist at Dublin, M.A. Cantab. [Cambridge], lecturer in
botany at Dublin municipal technical school, assistant professor of botany, R. Veterinarian
College Dublin; Dominion (economic) Botanist of Canada at Ottawa 1914-1938. (<em>J. Adams</em>).

* Adamson, Robert Stephen (1885-1965), British botanist, educated Kelvinside Academy,
Glasgow, studied at Univ. Edinburgh 1902-1907 (M.A. and D.Sc.), at Emmanuel College,
Cambridge 1907-1912, M.A. Cant. 1912, lecturer at Manchester Univ. 1907-1923, second
Harry Bolus Professor at Cape Town University 1923-1950, retired 1950 and settled again
in Great Britain 1955. (<em>Adamson</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: S. African material: BOL, CT, dupl. PRE, SAM, STE; British
material: BM (6000), CGE, OXF; Australia: MANCH; Corsica: BM, BOL, CT, MANCH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 15; BJI 2: 2; BL 1: 28, 71, 2: 243, 271; Clokie
p. 126; Desmond p. 4 (b. 2 Mar 1885, d. 6 Nov 1965, further refs.); Hortus 3: 1187; IH 2: 27;
Roon p. 9; TL-2/see T.M. Salter (vol. 5).

* Adanson, Michel (1727-1806), French botanist and explorer, born in Aix-en-Provence,
from 1730 resident in Paris, educated at the Collège du Cardinal Lemoine and the Collège de
France, later at the Jardin du Roi and the Collège Royal, more specifically interested in botany
from 1745; in Senegal as a bookkeeping clerk, but with the purpose to study the botany of
the area 1749-1754; from then on in Paris mainly dedicated to botany, member of Académie
Royale des Sciences in various ranks from 1750. (<em>Adans</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: See TL-2/1: 9, apart from the main collections at P, also some material
at PC; further Adanson material in G, P-JU and P-LA.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 2(2): 358; Ainsworth p. 10, 254, 311; Backer p. 7;
Barnhart 1: 16; BM 1: 11; Bossert p. 3; Dawson p. 6; Dryander 3: 20, 32, 217, 301, 400, 410,
415, 530; Frank 3(Anh.): 3; GR p. 59, 265; Hortus 3: 1187; HU 2: 582(index), see also 1:
287-288; IH 2: 27; Jackson p. 18, 352; Kew 1: 12; KR p. 4; Langman p. 67; Lasègue p. 21,
29, 316, 442, 504, 551, 557; LS 692-693; Moebius p. 441(index); Plesch p. 122-123; PR

PAGE: 27
HEADING: ADANSON

20-22, ed. 1: 44-45; SO 645, 646, 1398a, 2542a; TL-1: 1-2; TL-2/1: 9-10, 4: see p. 1160, 5:
no. 10.370, see Schreber and Scopoli, and see indexes; Tucker 1: 30; Zander ed. 10, p. 627,
ed. 11, p. 712.

Ade, Alfred (1876-1968), German amateur botanist, born in Sarbogard in Hungary, educated
in München at the Max-Gymnasium (1887-1893), at the Veterinarian college in München;
district veterinarian at Brückenau from 1912, later idem at Gemünden a. Main, Dr. h.c.
University of Würzburg 1951. (<em>Ade</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Destroyed by war action 1945.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 5(2): 541; DTS 6(4): 109; GR p. 1 (b. 17 Jul 1876,
Sarbogard, Hungary; d. 12 Nov 1968, Gemünden a. Main).

denseegebiet bis jetzt beobachteten wildwachsenden Phanerogamen und Gefässkryptogamen

HEADING: ADERHOLD

18.877. <em>Mykologische Beiträge</em> ... [Hedwigia ... 1923]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 29 Dec 1923 (in journal), p. 286-320. <em>Copy</em>: L. - Reprinted and to be cited from

Aderhold, Rudolf Ferdinand Theodor (1865-1907), German (Thüringen) mycologist and
phytopathologist; educated at the Realgymnasium in Frankenhausen and, from 1882, in
Nordhausen, at the University of Jena 1884, studying especially botany; 1885-1886 at the
University of Berlin with Eichler and Schwendener, from 1886 again in Jena as assistant in
the Botanical Institute until 1888; Dr. phil. ib. 9 Apr 1888; teacher's curriculum 1888-1889,
on active service 1889-1890, teacher at Iserlohn 1890-1891, at Dortmund 1891; assistant at
the horticultural academy at Geisenheim a. Rh. 1891-1893, teacher at the pomological
institute at Proskau 1893 (succeeding Sorauer)-1901, with the Sanitary Board (Kais. Gesund-
heitsamt) in Berlin 1901-1905, with the biology institution for agriculture and sylviculture at
Dahlem 1905, as director until 1907. (<em>Aderhold</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: De Toni 4: 1; LS 696-754, 30446-30475, add. 752-753;
Rehder 5(index): 5; Tucker 1: 30.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 65: 128. 1907 (d. 17 Mar 1907).
Behrens, J., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 25: (47)-(56). 1907 (biogr., bibl., b. 12 Feb 1865, Franken-
	hausen (Thüringen), d. 17 Mar 1907, Dahlem).
Pax, F., Schlesiens Pflanzenwelt 18. 1915; Bibl. schles. Bot. no. 1233. 1929.
Scholz, H., ed., Englera 7: 282. 1957.

18.878. <em>Revision der Species Venturia chlorospora, inaequalis und ditricha autorum</em> ...
[Hedwigia 1897]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 30 Apr 1897 (date in journal), p. [67]-83, <em>pl. 4</em> (uncol. drawing auct.). <em>Copy</em>: B. -
	Reprinted and to be cited from Hedwigia 36(2): 67-83, <em>pl. 4.</em> 1897.
<em>Ref</em>.: Meissner, Bot. Zeit. 55(9): 138-139. 1 Mai 1897 (rev.).

18.879. <em>Über den Vermehrungspilz</em>, sein Leben und seine Bekämpfung ... Sonder-Abdruck
aus "Gartenflora" 1897. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1897, p. [1]-13. <em>Copy</em>: L. - Reprinted from Gartenflora 1897: 114-126.

Botanischen Gesellschaft ... 1902. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 23 Apr 1902 (date of issue journal; Nat. Nov. Jun (2) 1903), p. [195]-200, <em>pl. 9</em> ("ix",

Aderholdt, August Eduard (1828-1890), German (Sachsen) physicist and chemist, born in
Nordhausen, educated at the Nordhausen "Gymnasium", studied at the Friedrich Wilhelm
University (Bonn). (<em>Aderholdt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

18.885. <em>De partibus anorganicis Lycopodii</em> chamaecyparissus et clavati. Dissertatio chemica
quam ad summos in philosophia honores auctoritate amplissimi philosophorum ordinis in
Universitate Fridericia Guilelmia rite capessendos scripsit et una cum sententiis controversis
die iv. mensis Februarii a mdccclii publice defendet ... Bonnae [Bonn] (Formis F.P. Lechneri)
1852. Oct. (<em>De part. anorg. Lycopodii</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 4 Feb 1852 (date of defense thesis), p. [i-iii], [1]-25, [26-27]. <em>Copy</em>: B. - "Vita" on p.
	[ii], theses on p. [iii].

Adler, Wilhelm (fl. 1834-1843), German botanist and proprietor of an estate in Wohlsdorf
in the Ziegenrücker Kreis, Prussian Saxony (exclave in Thüringen). (<em>W. Adler</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 17; BM 1: 12; PR 24, ed. 1: 48; Rehder 5(index): 6.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Baillon, H.E., Dict. bot. 1: 52. 1876.

	Libr. Uppsala).
Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Linnaea 19(2): 147. 1843 (living on his estate in Wohlsdorf by
	1843).

18.886. <em>Flora des Ziegenrücker Kreises</em> und der umliegenden Gegenden, oder: Verzeichniss
der daselbst wildwachsenden Pflanzen, nebst Angabe ihrer Wohnorte, Blüthezeiten, Dauer,
und ihres Nutzens für Landwirthe, Apotheker, Forstmänner, Maler, Gerber und Färber.
Herausgegeben von Wilhelm Adler ... Neustadt und Ziegenrück (bei Johann Karl Gottfried
Wagner) 1819. Oct. (<em>Fl. Ziegenrücker Kr.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Sep-Dec 1819 (preface date 1 Sep 1819), p. [i]-xviii, [1]-334. <em>Copies</em>: B-S, G.

* Adlerz, Ernst (1854-1918), Swedish botanist (bryologist) and teacher, educated at Lin-
köping and Uppsala, fil. kand. Uppsala 1878, fil. lic. 1881, fil. dr. 1882, lecturer natural history
and chemistry at a highschool in Örebro from 1885. (<em>Adlerz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: OREB (moss herb.); further material in A, GB; Adlerz general
herbarium went to Linköping's highschool (fide KR).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 17 (b. 6 Nov 1854, d. 8 Mar 1918); BM 1: 12;
CSP 9: 15, 13: 32; IH 2: 27; KR p. 4-5 (bibl.); Morren ed. 10, p. 106; NAF ser. 2, 3: 31; SBC
p. 114 ("Adl."); TL-2/1: 11.

Ährling, Johan Erik Ewald (1837-1888), Swedish (Södermanland) botanist, educated at
Maria School and Gymnasium, Stockholm, studied at Uppsala University 1856, fil. kand. ib.
1867, dr. phil. ib. 1872, amanuensis at the Uppsala botanical institute 1863-1867, teacher at
a state grammar school Arboga 1868-1888. (<em>Ährling</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Main herbarium unknown; GB (140 specimens).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Jackson p. 121; KR p. 791 (b. 18 Sep 1837, d. 5 Apr
1888); SO p. 7 (no. 37).

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Not. 1888: 150-151. 1888 (biogr. notice); Taxon 36(1): 299-300. 1987
	(microfiche ed. letters Linnaeus).
Blytt, A. and Th.O.B.N. Krok, Ann. Bot. 2(8): 393. 1889 (brief notes on life; bibl.).
Krok, Th.O.B.N., Ann. Bot. 2(8): 393. 1889 (obit. notes, list publ.).
Morren, E., Corr. bot. ed. 10: 103. 1884.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Vita Caroli Linnaei, <em>in</em> C. v. Linnés Ungdomskr. (Ährling editor) 1:
53- 87. 1888, see KR p. 436, no. 23 and p. 791. no. 6.
(2) Festen till C. v. Linnés minne, 1878, p. 65-106 (Linnés förkållande till sina lärjungar).
(3) Edited Caroli Linnaei opera hactenus inedita. <em>Flora Dalekarlica</em>. Ad verba Linnaei, p.
[iv], viii, 130; S0 249.

* Aellen, Paul (1896-1973), Swiss (Basel) botanist and teacher, studied natural sciences at
the University of Basel 1915-ca. 1920; director of the École Pestalozzi, Schaffhausen
1921-1927; teacher at various institutions at Basel 1928-1958; specialist on Chenopodium
and allies. (<em>Aellen</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: G (G-PAE); collections from Basel at BAS. - The Aellen herbarium
contains the herbaria of W.G. Herter (50.000, Uruguay) and G. Looser (30.000, Europe,
Chile); collections by J. Murr (Chenopod.), A. Ludwig, H. Wolf (crypt.), H. Bangerter and
H. Heinis (Roses) as well as the Thüringen herbarium of R. Scheuermann; for further details
see Burdet (1977). - For further information see P. Aellen, Jahresbericht 1962-1963 [through
1969-1975] der "Stiftung Herbarium Paul Aellen". Duplicates: AD, BM, F, GB, K, LAU,
LCU, LD, NJ, M, MVH, U, US.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 5(4): 40; Barnhart 1: 18; BFM 1172, 1173; Bossert p. 4;
Hortus 3: 1187; IH 1 (ed. 6): 355, 2: 27; Kew 1: 14-15; Langman p. 68; MW p. 2, suppl. p.
2; Roon p. 9; TL-2/1: 11, see also K.H. Rechinger; Zander ed. 11, p. 712.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Aellen, P., Jahresberichte der Stiftung "Herbarium Paul Aellen" 1962-1975 (sets at
	FAS, G).
Bochantsev, V.P., Bot. Zhurn. 59(3): 458. 1974 (Russian).
Brenan, J.P.M., Watsonia 10: 319-320. 1975 (notice of death).
Burdet, H.M., Candollea 32(2): 223-232. 1977 (obit., coll., bibl.; b. 13 Mai 1896, d. 19 Aug
	1973, portr.; main biographical source).
Castellanos, A. and R.A. Perez Moreau, Lilloa 7: 29. 1941.
Cowan, R.S., Taxon 22: 708. 1973 (notice of death).
Degener, O. and I., Newslett. Hawaiian Bot. Soc. 12: 31. 1973 (notice of death).
Dörr, E., Mitt. naturw. Arbeitsk. Kempten (Allgäu) 17(3): 1. 1973 (obit. not.).
Duvigneaud, J., Bull. Soc. Éch. Pl. vasc. Europ. Occ. Bass. Médit. 15: 8. 1974 (death notice).
Grüll, F., In commemoration of Paul Aellen s.l., sn. s.d. [1974], 2 p. (fide Burdet 1977).
Hürlimann, H., Bauhinia 5: 103-104. 1974 (memorial not.).
Looser, G., Bot. Soc. Argent. Bot. 15: 479-480. 1974 (biogr. not., portr.).
Zoller, H. and W. Greuter, Taxon 25: 213-214. 1976 (on Stiftung Herbarium Paul Aellen).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) With H.M. Iljin, <em>Chenopodium, in</em> Fl. SSSR 6: 41-73. 1936 (text
attributed only to Iljin; correction published on separate slip issued with Fl. SSSR 7. 1936).
(2) [outside our period, e.g. <em>Chenopodiaceae</em>, <em>in</em> Hegi, Ill. Fl. Mitteleur, ed. 2. 3(2-4): 693-747.
1961, and <em>Dysphaniaceae</em>, l.c. 3(2-4): 748. 1961; also <em>Chenopodiaceae</em>, <em>in</em> H. Merxmüller,
Prodr. Fl. S.W. Afr. 32: 1-22. Aug 1970; id., <em>in</em> P.H. Davis, Fl. Turkey 2: 294-339;
<em>Amaranthaceae</em>, <em>in</em> id. 2: 340-344. 1967.].

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Aellenia</em> Ulbrich (in E. Ulbrich, Nat. Pflanzenfam. ed. 2, 16c: 567. 1934).

* Afzelius, Adam (1750-1837), Swedish botanist, studied at Uppsala University from 1768,
Dr. phil. ib. 1776, hon. Dr. med. 1797, lecturer oriental languages ib. 1777, adjunct philosophy
1780, id. medicine and botanical assistant 1785, professor of botany 1803-1805; professor

PAGE: 34
HEADING: AFZELIUS

of materia medica from 1812, visited Sierra Leone 1792-1793, and again 1794-1796, travelled
in England and Scotland 1798. (<em>Afzel</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: See TL-2/1: 11. - Additional sets in PH (small set acquired with
herb. Gouan).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 11; Barnhart 1: 18 (b. 8 Oct 1750, Larv, Väster-
götland, d. 30 Jan 1837, Uppsala); BB p. 2-3; BM 1: 14; Clokie p. 121; CSP 1: 22; Dawson
p. 6-8, 821, 869, 915 (corr.); Desmond p. 4; Dryander 3: 168, 306, 351; Frank 3(Anh.): 3;
GR p. 470; Hegi 4(2): 1035; Hortus 3: 1187; IH 2: 28; Jackson p. 250; Kew 1: 16-17; KR p.
5-7, 504 (d. 1836, err.); Lasègue p. 344, 355, 444, 504; LS 759-760, 30.478; NAF 9(6); NDB
1: 356; PR 25-32, ed. 1: nos. 56-62; Rehder 1: 490, 5(index): 6; SBC p. 114 ("Afz."); SO
index p. 7; TL-2/see indexes; TR 8; Tucker 1: 30; Urban-Berl. p. 324; Zander ed. 10, p. 590,
627, ed. 11, p. 712.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., K. Vet. Akad. Handl. 1836: 342-345; Flora 23(1): 107-112. 1840 (Bibl. from
	K. Vet. Akad. Handl. 1838), see also Flora 20(1): 112. 1837 (d.); The heritage from Newton
	and Linnaeus, Stockholm 1963, p. 87.
Blunt, W., The compleat naturalist 183, 236. 1971.
Bridson, G.D.R. et al., Nat. hist. mss. resources Brit. Isl. 408. 1980.

Afzelius, Arvid August (1785-1872), Swedish clergyman, studied at Uppsala, Dr.phil. 1809,
ordained 1811, ultimately dean at Enköping. (<em>A.A. Afzel.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Afzelius, Karl [Rudolf] (1887-x), Swedish botanist, educated at primary and secondary schools in
Stockholm, from 1906-1911 at Stockholm University, fil. mag. ib. 1911, fil. lic. ib. 1915, scientist at the
Hortus Bergianus from 1915, later at the Botanical Department of the Stockholm Natural History Museum,
travelled in Madagascar 1912-1913, lecturer in botany at Stockholm University 1925. (<em>K. Afzel.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: S.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 19 (b. 25 Dec 1887, sic prob. err., see Afzelius
1957); BJI 2: 2; Roon p. 9; TL-2/9530, 12097.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Afzelius, K., biographical information for International Directory of Specialists (by
	A.C. de Roon) 1957 (b. 26 December 1887, sic).
Anon., Allg. bot. Z. 28/29: 54(110). 1925 (app. lecturer Stockh. Univ.).
Christensen, C., Dansk bot. Ark. 7: xii. 1932 (list publ. on Madagascar material K. Afzelius).
Dahlgren, K.V.O., <em>in</em> R.E. Fries, Short hist. bot. Sweden 97. 1950.
Fries, R.E., Short hist. bot. Sweden 46. 1950.

Afzelius, Pehr Conrad (1817-1850), Swedish botanist, son of Adam Afzelius, studied at
Uppsala 1836, med. kand. ib. 1848. (<em>P.C. Afzel.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some lichens in C, M and WRSL. - Afzelius herbarium was offered
for sale in Bot. Not. 1852: 15-16; it contained ca. 2500 phanerogams, lichens and mosses.
The present location is unknown to us.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 19; BM 1: 14; IH 2: 28; Jackson p. 350; KR p.
8 (b. 13 Apr 1817, Uppsala; d. 2 Mai 1850 ib.); PR 33, ed. 1: 63; Rehder 1: 354, 5(index): 6.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Hertel, H., Mitt. Bot. Staatssamml. München 16: 339. 1980 (some lichens at M via
Arnold).

18.914. <em>Novitiae florae Gotlandicae</em> quas venia experientiss. Facult. med. Upsal. praeside
D:re Georgio Wahlenberg ... p.p. auctor Petrus Conr. Afzelius ... in Auditorio Linnaeano d.
xii junii mdccxliv h.a.m.s. P. 1. Upsaliae [Uppsala] (excudebant Regiae Academiae Typo-
graphi) 1844. Oct. (<em>Nov. fl. Gotland.</em>).

<em>Thesis ed</em>.: 12 Jun 1844 (date of defense thesis), p. [1]-18. <em>Copies</em>: G, L, NY.
<em>Commercial issue</em>: 1844, p. [i], [1]-18. <em>Copy</em>: G (identical with thesis ed. plus an extra t.p.
	[i]). - The publication was not continued.

* Agardh, Carl Adolph (1785-1859), Swedish botanist at Lund; studied at Lund University
1799-1805; Dr. phil. ib. 1805; "docent" in mathematics 1807; "demonstrator" in botany 1810;
"adjunct" in applied economy 1811; professor of botany and applied economy, succeeding
Retzius, 1812; in various ecclesiastical functions from 1816; bishop Karlstads stift 1835;
bishop 1837; dr. theol. (1844) 1845; d. Karlstad 28 Jun 1859; travelled in Europe; Denmark,
Germany and Poland 1809; Denmark, Germany, Netherlands, Belgium, France and Italy
1821, 1827, 1833. (<em>C. Agardh</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Mainly at LD (orig.), duplicates issued as "Agardh's herbarium".
Further material at BM, FI, H (8 specimens), HBG, K, M (herb. Reinbold), PC, PH (herb.
Schweinitz), PR (200), S (phan.), WECO (a few specimens via herb. Barratt).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 19 (b. 13 Jan 1785, d. 28 Jan 1859); BM 1: 15;
Bossert p. 4; CSP 1: 22, 6: 564; De Toni 1: 1, 2: vi, 4: 1; DSB 1: 69-70. 1970 (by G. Eriksson);
Frank 3(Anh.): 3; GR p. 59, 470, <em>pl</em>. [<em>37</em>]; Hortus 3: 1187; IF p. 761; IH 2: 28; Jackson p. 513
[index]; Kew 1: 17-18; KR p. 8-13 (main bibl.); Krempelh. 2: 101-103; Langman p. 67;
Lasègue p. 539 [index]; Lenley p. 445; LS 761; Moebius p. 44 [index]; MW p. 2; NI 5-6; PR
34-54, ed. 1: 64-85; Rehder 1: 259, 5(index): 6; RS p. 71; Saccardo 1: 11, 2: 7; SBC p. 114;
SO 2668-2672; Stevenson p. 1234; TL-1: 2-3; TL-2/1-7 (see indexes names); Tucker 1: 30.

PAGE: 38
HEADING: AGARDH

	[2]). <em>Copy</em>: LD. - KR no. 4.
<em>German</em>: 1820, Conspectus specierum Nicotianae. Einige Worte über die Verbesserung des

18.917. <em>Icones algarum ineditae</em> (TL-2/41). 1821. 

<em>Fasc. 1</em>: Agardh handed a copy to Perthes and Besser in Hamburg shortly before 7 Jan 1821

	1821.

	<em>in</em> C.A. Agardh and C.E. Ljungberg, Försök till en statsekonomisk statistik öfver Sverige.
	Den Statsekonomiska afdelningen af C.A. Agardh. Den Statiska af C.E. Ljungberg, 3(1),
	1857, p. [i-xii, p. xii dated 10 Jul 1857], [1]-364. <em>Copies</em>: Almborn, B-S. - KR no. 15.

* Agardh, Jacob Georg (1813-1901), Swedish botanist in Lund, son of C.A. Agardh, studied
at Lund University from 1826, Dr. phil. ib. 1832, Dr. med. honoris causa Copenhagen 1879;
lecturer in botany at the University of Lund 1834, adjunct and botanical demonstrator 1836,
extraordinary professor of botany 1847, ordinary professor ib. 1854-1879; travelled and
botanized in Italy (1836-1837, 1840), France (1836-1837, 1856), England and Scotland
(1836-1837, 1854); outstanding algologist. (<em>J. Agardh</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LD (donated by A. 1895). - Algae (worldwide): B, BAS, BP, C, CGE
(<em>Lupinus</em>), DWC, FI, HBG, K, KIEL, L, LD, MANCH, PC, W. - Swedish phanerogams in
LD, P and S. - J.G. Agardh presented C.A. Agardh's herbarium to LD in 1878, and his own
herbarium ib. in 1895; his library was given to LD in 1897 and 1909 (fide KR).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 19 (further refs.); BM 1: 15-16; Bossert p. 4; CSP
1: 22-23, 7: 11, 9: 17, 13: 36; De Toni 1: i-ii, 4: i-ii; DSB 1: 70-71; Frank 3(Anh.): p. 4; GR
p. 470; Hortus 3: 1187; IF p. 675; IH 1 (ed. 6): 355, 2: 28; Jackson (see index); Kew 1: 18-19;
KR p. 13-19 (b. 8 Feb 1813, d. 17 Feb 1901; bibl. of 66 nos.); Lasègue p. 391, 559 (index);
Lenley p. 2, 445; Moebius p. 66-68, 88, 91, 92; MW 1: 2; PR 55-66; Rehder 5(index): 6;
Saccardo 1: 11-12, 2: 7; SO index p. 7; TL-1: 3; TL-2/1: 18-21, see also 4: 1160 (index),
10.281; Tucker 1: 30; Urban-Berl. p. 262; Zander ed. 10, p. 627, ed. 11, p. 712.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Almborn, O., Bot. Not. 133: 455-457, 463, 472. 1900 (brief evaluation, portr. on p.
456).
Anon., Flora 24(1): 48. 1841 (leave of absence for two years to travel to S. Europe), 39(1):
	14. 1856 (succeeds J.W. Zetterstedt as regular prof. of botany in Lund); Bot. Zeit. 37: 710.
	1879 (F.W.C. Areschoug appointed successor to J.G. Agardh as regular prof. of botany at
	Lund); Nat. Nov. 16: 105. 1894 (app. Knight of the Prussian Order "Pour le mérite"), 17:
	310. Jul 1895; Hedwigia 34 (Rep.): 67. 1895; Bot. Monatschr. 15(12): 335. 1897 (leaves
	his botanical library to LD); Leopoldina 37(3): 32-33. 1901 (obit.); Gen.-Reg. Bot. Not.
	1839-1938: 85, 166 (many refs. to entries in Bot. Not.) 1939; National encycl. 1: 106. 1989.

18.947. <em>Om structuren hos Champia</em> och Lamentaria med anledning af nyare tydningar ...
Öfversigt af Kongl. Vetenskaps-Akademiens Förhandlingar ... 1888. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: Mar 1888 (mss. submitted 8 Feb 1888; Nat. Nov. Apr (3) 1888, p. 49-67). <em>Copy</em>: B. -
	Published in and to be cited from Öfvers. Förh. K. Sv. Vet.-Akad. 45(2): 49-67. 1888.
<em>Ref</em>.: KR p. 17 (no. 38).

Agharkar, Shankar Purusottum (1884-1960), Indian botanist (Bombay born), educa-
ted at Ratnagiri and Dhawar, from 1901-1909 at the University of Bombay, B.A. 1906,
M.A. botany, zoology and geology 1908, lecturer and head of the Biology Department
of Elphinston College Bombay 1910-1913, at the Indian Museum Calcutta 1911-early
1914, Ghosh professor of botany at the University of Calcutta 1913, studied at the
University of Berlin with A. Engler 1914, temporarily interned 1914- 1917, again with
Engler et al. 1917-1919, Dr. phil. Univ. Berlin December 1919, visited the major
European herbaria 1920 obtaining a basis for the herbarium CAL, from July 1919 at the
Botany Dept. of Calcutta University until 1946, from then on resident at Poona.
(<em>Agharkar</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: CAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 20; IH 2: 28.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Agharkar, S., Verbr.-Mitt. Xerophyt. p. 42. 1920 ("Lebenslauf").
Chatterjee, D., Sci. and Cult. 26: 173-174. 1960 (portr., obit. not.); Bull. Bot. Soc. Bengal
	12: 1-5. 1958 [issued 1961] (portr., obit.).
Frodin, D.G., Guide standard floras world 1984, no. 410a.
Kundu, B.C., Taxon 11(7): 209-211. 1962 (biogr., bibl., b. 18 Nov 1884, d. 9 Sep 1960) (see
	also Fl. males. Bull. 18: 970. 1963).
Mahabalé, T.S., J. Ind. Bot. Soc. 40: 131-134. 1961 (portr.).
Navalkar, B.S., J. Bombay Nat. Hist. Soc. 57: 635-636. 1960 (1961).

<sm>FESTSCHRIFT</sm>: Mahabalé, T.S., ed., Professor S.P. Agharkar commemoration volume, Univer-
sity of Poona, Poona 7: vi, portr., 144 p., 21 Sep 1961; contains a detailed biographical sketch
(on p. 1-12) by T.S. Mahabalé and G.T. Tonapi.

Agnér, Gustaf Frederik Hjalmar (1854-1898), Swedish physician and botanist, studied at
secondary schools at Växjö and Lund, medical student at the Stockholm Karolingska Institut
1889; practising physician ib. from 1892-1898. (<em>Agnér</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at NH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: KR p. 19 (b. 30 Nov 1854 Växjö; d. 15 Sep 1898, Stockholm).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1897, p. [i-vii, sic], [7]-117, [118-123 index]. <em>Copy</em>: LD. - Not continued.

Agnethler, Michael Gottlieb, Ritter von (1719-1752), Transilvanian Saxonian (Her-
mannstadt) physician, botanist, numismatist and theologian, studied theology in
Hermannstadt [present Sibiu, Rumania] and (1742) Halle, Dr. phil. ib. 1750, Dr. med.
ib. 1751, also dedicating himself to theology, philosophy and history, later studying
medicine, ultimately professor at the University ("Academy") of Helmstädt.
(<em>Agnethler</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 1: 140 (b. 10 Jun 1719, d. 15 Jan 1752); Barnhart 1:
20 (d. 17 Jan 1752 at Helmstädt; discusses "Gottlieb" versus "Georg"); BM 1: 19; Dryander
3: 274; Kanitz no. 46; PR 69, ed. 1: 93; Rehder 5(index): 7; Tucker 1: 31.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Barth, H. ed., Von Honterus zu Oberth. Bedeutende siebenbürgisch-deutsche
	Naturwissenschaftler 372-378. 1980.
Fournier, E., <em>in</em> H.E. Baillon, Dict. bot. 1: 73. 1876.

Hulth, J.M. Bref. Skrifv. Linné 2(1): 6. 1916.

see TL-2/4711.

* Agosti, Giuseppe, Conte (1715-1786), Italian jesuit and botanist at Belluno. (<em>Agosti</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: PAD (see TL-2/1: 23 and P.A. Saccardo 2: 7-8, 1904 on collections
made by H.H. Zanichelli, Bartholomeus Martini and Agosti himself, the latter made in 1769
and rd. at Padua in 1903).

2: 7-8, 117, Cron. p. xiii; TL-1: 3; TL-2/1: 23, see also 9937.

Dandy, J.E., Regn. veg. 51: 8-9. 1967 (on the status of A's inferiora genera; his higher groups,
	numbered but <em>not named</em> are his genera; the named subdivisions are not genera and their

	Sci. nat. ser. 2, 1: 5-13. 1904; Atti Ist. Venet. 63: [1-122], <em>1 pl</em>. 1904 (on A's botanical ills.).

Ahern, George Patrick (1859-1942) American forester, organizer of the Bureau of Forestry,
Philippines 1910, collector and organizer of plant collecting in the Philippines 1910-1915,
captain, later lieutenant colonel, in the 9th U.S. Infantry; after 1915 on duty at the Army War
College, living in Washington D.C. (<em>Ahern</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: A, B, BO, CU, DS, F, L, MO, NY, PNH, POM, US (1867), UT, YU
(partly collected by his collectors).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 21 (b. 29 Dec 1859); BL 1: 6; IH 2: 28; SK 1: 8
(detailed info.), 4: 82; Tucker 1: 31; Urban-Berl. p. 324.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Frodin, D.G., Guide standard floras world 1984: nos. 493b and 925.
Merrill, E.D., Enumeration of some recently collected plants of A., Fragm. Fl. Philipp. 4-66,
	77-202. 1904.
Quisumbing, E., Philipp. Geogr. J. 8: 30. 1964.

* Ahles, Wilhelm Elias von (1829-1900), German (Württemberg) botanist, Dr. phil. Jena
1853; high school teacher Heidelberg 1853, private lecturer ("Privatdozent") at the University
of Heidelberg, 1859, professor of general and pharmaceutical botany at the technical
University Stuttgart 1885-1899. (<em>Ahles</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: STU, further material at CERN, L, LD, M (in herb. F. Arnold), WRSL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 21 (b. 20 Sep 1829 Neckarburken nr. Mosbach,
d. 29 Aug 1900, Stuttgart); BM 1: 20; Frank 3(Anh.): 4; GR p. 1, <em>pl</em>. [<em>12</em>]; IH 2: 28; Jackson
p. 66, 167, 298; LS 766-769; TL-2/1: 23, see also 2835, 11.809.

PAGE: 47
HEADING: AHLES

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Ahles, W.E. von, Bot. Monatschr. 7(2): 31. 1889 (taught general botany, principles

Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 80: 400. 1899 (retired), 84: 175. 1900; Hedwigia 39: (40). 1900; Bot.

<sm>WANDTAFELN</sm> (wall diagrams): Ahler issued a first set of 8 wall charts in Ravensburg
1873, accompanied by a text-booklet of 52 p., <em>Botanische Wandtafeln</em>. Die Lehre von
der Gestalt der Zelle, der Gewebe und der Blüte, nebst den darauf bezüglichen
Vorgängen, Ravensburg 1873 (see BM 1: 20; Bot. Zeit. 3 Jan 1873 (sic)). The charts
themselves were termed <em>Botanische Wandtafeln</em>. - These wall diagrams were not the
first, see Jackson p. 66 for a chronological list starting with B. Balfour's illustrations
of botany (1850?). For a review of A's <em>Botanische Wandtafeln</em> see ÖBZ 24: 95-96.
1874.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Actual author of C.F. Hochstetter, <em>Giftgew. Deutschl.</em> (TL-2/2835),
ed. 3, 1874-1876.
(2) Introduction to C.A.J.A. Oudemans, <em>Afb. beschr. handelspl.</em> 1882 (TL-2/7153).
(3) Edited and augmented ed. 5 of M.A. Seubert, <em>Grundr. Bot.</em> ed. 5, 1883, TL-2/11.813, rev.
by E. Koehne, Bot. Zeit. 42: 347-348. 30 Mai 1884, Id. ed. 7, Leipzig (C.F. Winter), 1887
(Bot. Centralbl. 25-29 Apr 1887), vi, 621 p. (Rev. by M. Moebius, Bot. Centralbl. 32: 1-3.
3-7 Oct 1887.

18.954. <em>De Germaniae pertusariis</em>, Conotremate et Phlyctidibus commentatio. Dissertatio

<em>Publ</em>.: 1860, p. [i]-vi, [3]-20. <em>Copy</em>: G.

HEADING: AHLFVENGREN

Ahlfvengren, Frederik Elias (1862-1921), Swedish botanist, studied at a secondary school
in Visby 1876-1882, at the University of Lund 1883, fil. kand. ib. 1888, fil. lic. 1893, Dr.
phil. 1897; teacher at various schools in the Stockholm area 1894-1902; lector in natural
history and chemistry at a secondary school at Holmstad 1902, idem in Stockholm (Norrma-
len) from 1909; from 1883 an active member of Lunds botaniska förening. (<em>Ahlfvengren</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: S, further material at A, GB.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 21; BL 2: 513, 525; BM 1: 21; IH 2: 29; KR p. 19-20
(bibl., b. 7 Apr 1862 Gervalls i Hejde, d. 22 Dec 1921 Stockholm); Rehder 5(index): 7.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Not. 1922: 109, 1933: 14.
Gertz, O., Sv. bot. Tidskr. 40(1): 93-98. 1946 (biogr., portr., bibl.).
Hasslow, O., Bot. Not. 1933: 49 (activity in Lunds Bot. för.).
Peterson, B., Sv. bot. Tidskr. 83: 60-61. 1989.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: Collaborator of L.M. Neuman in his <em>Sver. fl.</em> 1901, TL-2/6756 and <em>Herb.
Suec.</em> 1901, TL-2/6757. Rev. of <em>Sver. fl.</em> by Grevillius, Bot. Centralbl. 88: 387-388. 23 Dec 1901.

18.957. <em>Bidrag</em> till kännedomen om <em>Compositéstammens anatomiska byggnad</em>. Akademisk
afhandling. Som med vederbörligt tillstånd för erhållande af filosofisk doktorsgrad vid Lunds
Universitet till offentlig granskning framställes onsdagen den 11 November 1896 kl. 10 f.m.
å Botaniska lärosalen ... Lund (E. Malmströms Boktrycken) 1896. Qu. (<em>Bidr. Compo-
sitéstamm. anat. byggn.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 11 Nov 1896 (date of defense thesis; Nat. Nov. Dec (2) 1896), cover-t.p., p. [i, t.p.],
	1-86, [87, contents]. <em>Copies</em>: B, GB-UB, MO, NSUB, U. - This thesis fulfilled the first
	requirement of the doctor's examination, the degree was awarded on 31 Mai 1897. -
	Promotor and teacher: F.W.C. Areschoug. - Also published as Årb. Lunds Bot. Inst. xiv.

18.958. <em>Hallands växter</em>. Förteckning över fanerogamer och kärlkryptogamer. Lund (Förlag
A.B. Gleerupska Universitätsbokhandeln). 1924. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1924 (ÖBZ rd. Oct-Dec 1924; Nat. Nov. Dec 1924), <em>1 portr</em>. (col.), p. [i]-xix, [1]-207.
	<em>Copies</em>: NY, B. Peterson.

	Sernander, J.R., Sv. Natur 1925: 161 (rev.).
	Skottsberg, C., Göteborgs Handels- och Sjöfarts-Tidning 16 Aug 1924 (rev.).

* Ahlner, Klas (1845-1932), Swedish botanist and highschool teacher, studied at a secondary

Ahlner, Sten Gustaf Edward (1905-x), Swedish lichenologist; studied at the University of
Uppsala, fil. mag. 1930, fil. lic. 1936, Dr. phil. Uppsala 1948, lecturer at the University of
Uppsala, from 1950 at the Naturhistoriska Riksmuseum, Stockholm. (<em>Ahlner</em>).

PAGE: 50
HEADING: AHLQUIST

Ahlquist, Abraham (1794-1844), Swedish (Öland) vicar, rural dean and botanist, studied at
Uppsala from 1813, Dr. phil. ib. 1818, at highschool in Kalmar 1820, teacher in natural history
at the Kalmar "gymnasium" 1821-1826, conrector ib. 1825, later pastor in Runsten, Öland,
from 1831 as dean. (<em>Ahlquist</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: UPS, GB (5 specimens).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 22; BL 2: 536; BM 1: 21; KR p. 20 (b. 5 July
1794, d. 9 Jul 1844); PR 72-73, ed. 1: 100-101; Rehder 5(index): 7.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Ahlquist, A., Autobiography 1813-1844, mss. in archives Mrs. B. Hagstedt, Grytgöl,
	Sweden.
Anon., Bot. Not. 1844: 176 (d. 9 Jul 1844, 51 yrs. old, obit. not.).
Björk, Kalmar nations skriftserie 16: 7-31. 1940 (portr.).
Lundqvist, Å., Ölandsk bygd 1964: 37-38 (portr.); Sv. Linnésällsk. Årsskr. 1975-77: 29-31,
	44-47. 1981 (portr.).
Sterner, K.R., Ölands växtvärld. Södra Kalmar län 3: 10-11. 1926; Acta phytogeogr. Suec.
	5: 7. 1938 (portr.); Ölands kärlväxtflora ed. 2, by Å. Lundqvist 10-11. 1986.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) <em>Flora runsteniensis</em> dissertation defended under Thunberg, see TL-
2/14.393. The part of Ahlquist as author is not quite clear. However, Krok lists this Flora
under Ahlquist who published three further botanical papers. The <em>Flora runsteniensis</em> is
available on IDC 619 (nos. 79-83).

<sm>CORRESPONDENCE</sm>: KVA, UPS-UB. - Botanical and other mss. at Kalmar stifts- och
gymnasiebibl., Norrköpings stiftbibl.

18.967. <em>Anmärkningar om Ölands</em> fysiska beskaffenhet och <em>vegetation</em> ... Stockholm (Tryckte
hos J.P. Lindhs Enka) 1822. Oct. (<em>Anmärk. Ölands Veg.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1822, p. [1]-29 ["39"]. <em>Copy</em>: G. - Preprinted or reprinted from Kongl. Sv. Vet.-Akad.
	Handl. 1821(2): 278-304. - See also G. Wahlenberg, <em>Ytterligare</em> anmärkningar om Ölands
	natur, ib. 1821: 305-319, TL-2/16.522, in fact an appendix to A's paper.

Ahnfelt, Nils Otto (1801-1837), Swedish botanist and ecclesiastical historian, studied at
Lund 1816-1820, Dr.phil. Lund 1820, lecturer in dogma and church history ib.; travelled in
S.W. Norway with A.E. Lindblom 1826, private teacher in Greifswald (Germany) 1833-1835,
returned to Lund to take his degree, again in Greifswald Aug-Oct 1836, returned to Lund
because of his illness. (<em>Ahnfelt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: S (from 1913 onward; for moss collection see KR p. 21, footnote;
further material at M (lich.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 22; BM 1: 21; Frank 3(Anh.): 4; GR p. 485; KR
p. 21 (b. 31 Oct 1801, Skåne; d. 1 Jan 1837, Lund); PR 74, ed. 1: 103.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Not. 1912: 113-117 (on moss herb.).
Arnell, H.W., Sv. biogr. lex. 1: 330-331. 1918.
Baillon, H.E., Dict. bot. 1: 76. 1876.
Hertel, H., Mitt. Bot. Staatssamml. München 16: 339. 1980 (some lichens at M).
Hornschuch, C.F., Flora 20(1): 175-176. 1837 (brief obit.).
Lindman, S., Sv. män o. kvinnor 1: 43. 1942.
Möller, H., Bot. Not. 1912: 113-117 (on A. and his moss herbarium).
Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Linnaea 19(2): 147. 1843.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) <em>Musci</em>, <em>in</em> E.Fries, <em>Novit. fl. suec. alt.</em> 290-302. 1828, see TL-2/1871.
(2) <em>Agaricus (Lepiota) cingulatus, in</em> E. Fries, Eclogae fungorum <em>in</em> Linnaea 5: [507], 723,

Aichinger von Aichenhayn, Josef (1789-1870), Austrian botanist and soldier as k.k. Major
in retirement in Stein ca. 1852, also sometime professor at the Neustädter Militär-Akademie,
before 1855 active in Wien, Stein and Graz, ultimately in Salzburg. (<em>Aichinger</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>CORRESPONDENCE</sm>: Letter to Kerner, in Dörflers Sammlung at UPS-Univ. Libr., see H.W.
Lack and O.v. Sydow, Willdenowia 13: 410. 1983.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 23 (b. 1789, d. Jun 1870); BM 1: 21; DTS 1: 1;
GR p. 446; Jackson p. 270; PR 75; Rehder 1: 440, 5(index): 7.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., ÖBW 2(1): 1. Jan 1852 (listed in "Botaniker Oesterreichs"); ÖBZ 20: 319.
	1870 (died Jun 1870 in Salzburg at the age of 81).
Baillon, H.E., Dict. bot. 1: 76. 1876.
Neilreich, A., Gesch. Bot. Nieder-Österr. <em>in</em> Verh. zool.-bot. Ver. Wien 5: 57. 1855 (brief
	curr. vitae).
Stieber, M.T. et al., Huntia 4(1): 17. 1981 (plant labels in HU-archives).

1847. Oct. (<em>Bot. Führer Wien</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1847 (Heft 1: Bot. Zeit. rev. 24 Sep 1847 and rd. at Leipzig (Börsenblatt) 16-19 Jun
	1846, no further information found on parts 2-7), p.[i]-iv, [v], [1]-524, [1]-136. <em>Copies</em>: B,

<em>Ref</em>.: Schlechtendahl, D.F.L. von, Bot. Zeit. 5: 691. 24 Sep 1847 ("Probeheft", 32 p.).

* Aigret, [Louis] Clément [Joseph] (1856-1921), Belgian amateur botanist at Olloy-lez-
Couvin. (<em>Aigret</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LV (Bryophytes fide G. Sayre, 1977, Lichenes fide Laundon, 1979),
M (Lichenes fide Hertel, 1980, p. 340, 1988, p. 140). - Aigret issued <em>Herbier des Muscinées
de la Belgique</em>, with Vital François (Bot. Centralbl. 30: 128. 1887), cent. 1 issued 1887 (Bot.
Zeit. 45: 646. 30 Sep 1887, Nat. Nov. Mai 1887).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 23; BL 2: 29, 42; BM 1: 21; CSP 13: 41; De Toni
2: vi; GR p. 609; LS 776-778, 3048a; TL-2/1: 24; Tucker 1: 31.

Hertel, H., Mitt. Bot. Staatssamml. München 16: 340. 1980 (lich. at M via Arnold).
Laundon, J.R., Lichenologist 11: 6. 1979 (also lich. at LV).

18.971. <em>Flore de la Belgique. Plantes médicinales</em> et traité de médecine familière. Plantes
exotiques et produits pharmaceutiques. Analyse et description des espèces indigènes...
Olloy-lez-Mariembourg. 1886. (<em>Fl. Belg. Pl. médic.</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: Vital François.
<em>Publ</em>.: Mai-Jun 1886 (Nat. Nov. Jul 1886, Bot. Centralbl. 16-20 Aug 1886), p. [1]-199, [1]-12.
	<em>Copy</em>: n.v., see BL 2: 29.

18.972. <em>Flore de la Belgique</em>. En herborisation ou guide de l'aspirant botanique ... Bruxelles
(...Charles Coppée) [1889]. Oct. (<em>Fl. Belg.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jan-Feb 1889 (Bot. Zeit. 29 Mar 1889, Nat. Nov. Mar (1) 1889), p. [1]-159, [160].
	<em>Copy</em>: BR. - Apparently a consolidated reprint with independent pagination from a
	periodical. We have not succeeded in tracing this periodical. The pages of the reprint give
	(other) page numbers from a “périodique 4.”, (possibly Ann. Trav. publics Belg. ser. 2. 4.
	1889?). The dates of publication in the periodical will most probably be earlier than that
	of the consolidated reprint.

18.973. <em>Flore analytique et descriptive des plantations le long des routes</em> de l'État en Belgique
... Bruxelles (J. Goemare, ...) 1905. Oct. (<em>Fl. anal. plantat. routes</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Dec 1905 or early 1906 (t.p. date 1905, plates <em>5-10</em> dated Dec 1905, however: Nat.
	Nov. Oct (2) 1906, Bot. Centralbl. 4 Dec 1906), cover-t.p., p. [1]-217, <em>pl. 1-10</em> (uncol.

	779-800, <em>pl. 21</em>, 997-1042, <em>pl. 27-29</em>, 1191-1286, <em>pl. 33-38.</em> 1905 (journal issue n.v.).

for 56 years. (<em>Aiken</em>).

HEADING: AINSLIE

Aikin, John (1747-1822), British (Leicester-born) physician and naturalist; studied medicine
in London and Edinburgh, practising in various places, M.D. Leiden 1784, practising in
Yarmouth 1784-1792, removed to London 1797, abandoned his medical profession for health
reasons 1797, retired to Stoke Newington (London). (<em>Aikin</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 23; BB p. 3; BM 1: 1, 21; CSP 1: 28; Desmond
p. 4 (b. 15 Jan 1747, d. 7 Dec 1827, further biogr. refs.); DNB 1: 185-186; Jackson p. 244;
PR ed. 1: 106; Rehder 1: 393; Tucker 1: 31.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Bridson, G.D.R. et al., Nat. hist. mss. res. Brit. Isl. 5.36. 1980.
Britten, J., J. Bot. 42: 294. 1904.
Dallman, A.A. and M.H. Wood, Trans. Liverpool Bot. Soc. 1: 56. 1909 (biogr. info., b.
	Kilworth Harcourt, Leicester 15 Jan 1747, d. Stoke Newington (London), Middlesex 7 Dec
	1822).
Fox, R.H., Dr. John Fothergill 131, 135, 154. 1919.
Freeman, R.B., Brit. nat. hist. books 1495-1900. 26. 1980.
Horwood, A.R. and C.W.F. Noel, Fl. Leicestershire cxcviii. 1933.
Lisney, A.A., Bibl. Brit. Lepidopt. 1688-1799, p. 214-221 (portr., bibl.)
Walter, J.H.F., Trans. Norfolk Norwich naturalists Soc. 9(5): 685-687. 1914.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Aikinia</em> Wallich 1832 was named after Arthur Aikin (1773-1854), British chemist.
This name was a later synonym of <em>Ratzeburgia</em> Kunth. - Robert Brown gave then the name
<em>Aikinia</em> to another plant for John Aikin on 15 Aug 1832, see ING 1: 43.

18.975. <em>The woodland companion</em>: or a brief description of British trees. With some account
of their uses... compiled by the author of Evenings at home ... London (Printed for J.Johnson,
...by Taylor and Wilks, ...). 1802. Oct. (<em>Woodland comp</em>.).

<em>Ed. 1</em>: 1802, p. [i-iv], [1]-92, <em>pl. 1-28. Copies</em>: L, MO. - Published anonymously except that
	the "advertisement" on p. [iii] is signed "J.A.". Later editions identified.
<em>Ed. 2</em>: 1815, p. [i-iv], [1]-92, <em>pl. 1-28. Copies</em>: MO, NY. - "Second edition, corrected".
<em>Ed. 3</em>: 1820, p. [i-iv], [1]-92, <em>pl. 1-28. Copy</em>: HH.

Aikin, William Edward Augustin (1807-1888), American botanist and chemist, studied at
the Renselaer Institute, lic. N.Y. State Med. Soc. and hon. M.D. Vermont Academy of
medicine, in Baltimore from 1832 in various capacities at the University of Maryland,
professor of chemistry 1837-1883, emeritus professor 1883-1888, L.L.D. 1843. (<em>W. Aikin</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: PH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 1: 23 (b. 1807, Troy, N.Y.; d. 30 Mai 1888,

Pennell, F.W. and J.H. Barnhart, Monogr. Acad. Nat. Sci. Philadelphia 1: 599. 1935 (coll. at
	PH).

	55-91. 1837. No reprint seen.

conservator of forests, Nigeria. (<em>Ainslie</em>).

Ainslie, [Sir] Whitelaw (1767-1836), British physician and medical botanist, M.D. Leiden
1786, knighted 1837, surgeon in the East Indian Company 1788-1815, asst. surgeon until ca.
1789, garrison surgeon Chingleput, India ca. 1789, surgeon Ganjam 1794, superintending
surgeon 1810, id. Madras army, southern div. 1814. (<em>W. Ainslie</em>).
